level.text: The following categories of expenses shall be excluded from allowable operating costs because they are not normally incurred in providing resident care:
Salaries of officers not performing managerial duties;
Fund raising expenses in excess of ten percent (10%) of the amount raised;
Free care or discounted services;
Parties and social activities not related to resident care;
Personal telephone, radio, and telephone services;
Gift, flower and coffee shop expenses;
Vending machines;
Organization Membership not related to resident cares
All services covered by direct provider payments under Medicaid, Medicare Part B, CHAMPUS, Blue Cross/Blue Shield, various other insurers or third party resources;
Interest expenses and penalties due to late payment of bills or taxes, or for licensure violations;
District of Columbia provider tax cost. If the provider tax is enacted after March 31, 1996 it shall not be excluded from allowable costs; and
Pharmacy expenses paid under the Point of Sale reimbursement system.
The following shall reduce allowable costs:
Costs related to revenue from laundry and linen service;
Employee and guest meals;
Sale of drugs to other parties;
Sale of medical and surgical supplies to parties other than customers;
Sale of medical records and abstracts;
Rental of quarters to employees and parties other than customers;
Rental of space;
Purchase discounts and allowances;
Rebates and refunds of expenses;
Investment income for unrestricted funds to the extent that it exceeds interest expense on investments;
Recovery of an insured loss; and
Grants, gift, and income from endowments designated by the donor for specific operating expenses.
